focusAreas.name: Change Significance Gate
questions: FIRST: Is this a meaningful code change that warrants detailed review? Trivial changes (content text edits, hiding elements, adding a line) should be acknowledged with 'âœ… Trivial change, no review needed' and you should NOT address the other review points. Only proceed with the full review for structural code changes, new logic, refactoring, or architectural decisions.

focusAreas.name: Implementation Completeness
questions: Does the implementation actually do what it claims, or just return hardcoded values?
Are all the features actually working, or just pretending to work?

focusAreas.name: Code Quality
questions: Is there duplicated logic that should be extracted?
Is the code more complex now than it needs to be?

focusAreas.name: Integration & Refactoring
questions: Does the code structure still make sense after your additions?
Should you consolidate similar functions that now exist?
Did you leave any temporary workarounds or hacks?

focusAreas.name: Codebase Consistency
questions: Did you update all the places that depend on what you changed?
Are there related files that need the same changes?
Should your solution be applied elsewhere for consistency?
